description: Components (or COMPs) are unique compared to other operator families in that they contain their own networks. To make a new network in your project, create a new Component using the OP Create Menu and select from the COMP tab. Then go inside your new component and start building your network. Component networks can contain operators and/or additional sub-networks (additional components). Sub-networks create a hierarchy of networks that can be navigated (using the network path) and forms the overall hierarchical structure of .toe/.tox files.

operators.name: Base COMP
operators.description: the Base COMP has no panel gadgets and no object gadgets. It is the most basic shell of a component and can be used when a new network is required.

operators.name: Engine COMP
operators.description: the Engine COMP will run a .tox file (component) in a separate process.

operators.name: Time COMP
operators.description: the Time COMP contains a network of operators that can drive a Timeline, drive animations in Animation COMPs, or be used to drive any custom time-based system.

operators.name: Animation COMP
operators.description: the Animation COMP is used to create keyframe animation data. Keyframed channels are stored inside the component and can be edited by scoping the Animation COMP in the Animation Editor.

operators.name: Replicator COMP
operators.description: the Replicator COMP creates a node for every row of a table, adding and deleting nodes ('replicants') as the table changes.

operators.name: Window COMP
operators.description: the Window COMP create a separate floating application window. This can be used for control panels or when outputting to multiple monitors.
